meanings.definition: Isogonals: lines or edges that are of equal length
meanings.sent1: The artist carefully drew the isogonals of the shape to ensure they were all the same length.
meanings.sent2: In the map, the isogonals helped to show areas with equal distances.
meanings.sent3: The isogonals on the blueprint were so perfectly aligned that it looked like a work of art.
meanings.sent4: Her precision in drawing the isogonals was like a symphony of equal lengths.
meanings.sent5: The isogonals on the graph paper formed a beautiful pattern of uniformity.

meanings.definition: Isogonals: a geometric figure with equal angles
meanings.sent1: The isogonals of the polygon all had the same angles, making it a perfect shape.
meanings.sent2: The isogonals of the triangle were carefully measured to ensure they were equal.
meanings.sent3: The isogonals of the square were so identical that it almost seemed magical.
meanings.sent4: The isogonals of the circle created a sense of harmony and balance in the design.
meanings.sent5: The isogonals of the shape formed a symmetrical masterpiece of angles.

meanings.definition: Isogonals: having equal sides or angles
meanings.sent1: The isogonals sides of the rectangle made it a perfect shape for the frame.
meanings.sent2: The isogonals angles of the triangle ensured it was an equilateral shape.
meanings.sent3: The isogonals design of the building gave it a sense of balance and symmetry.
meanings.sent4: Her isogonals haircut was so precise that it looked like it was done by a professional.
meanings.sent5: The isogonals pattern on the fabric created a visually appealing look.
